verses.verse: A Prayer<WH8605> of the afflicted<WH6041>, when he is overwhelmed<WH5848>, and poureth out<WH8210> his complaint<WH7879> before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068>. Hear<WH8085> my prayer<WH8605>, O LORD<WH3068>, and let my cry<WH7775> come<WH935> unto thee.

Hide<WH5641> not thy face<WH6440> from me in the day<WH3117> when I am in trouble<WH6862>; incline<WH5186> thine ear<WH241> unto me: in the day<WH3117> when I call<WH7121> answer<WH6030> me speedily<WH4118>.
For my days<WH3117> are consumed<WH3615> like smoke<WH6227>, and my bones<WH6106> are burned<WH2787> as an hearth<WH4168>.
My heart<WH3820> is smitten<WH5221>, and withered<WH3001> like grass<WH6212>; so that I forget<WH7911> to eat<WH398> my bread<WH3899>.
By reason of the voice<WH6963> of my groaning<WH585> my bones<WH6106> cleave<WH1692> to my skin<WH1320>.
I am like<WH1819> a pelican<WH6893> of the wilderness<WH4057>: I am like an owl<WH3563> of the desert<WH2723>.
I watch<WH8245>, and am as a sparrow<WH6833> alone<WH909> upon the house top<WH1406>.
Mine enemies<WH341> reproach<WH2778> me all the day<WH3117>; and they that are mad<WH1984> against me are sworn<WH7650> against me.
For I have eaten<WH398> ashes<WH665> like bread<WH3899>, and mingled<WH4537> my drink<WH8249> with weeping<WH1065>,
Because<WH6440> of thine indignation<WH2195> and thy wrath<WH7110>: for thou hast lifted me up<WH5375>, and cast me down<WH7993>.
My days<WH3117> are like a shadow<WH6738> that declineth<WH5186>; and I am withered<WH3001> like grass<WH6212>.
But thou, O LORD<WH3068>, shalt endure<WH3427> for ever<WH5769>; and thy remembrance<WH2143> unto all<WH1755> generations<WH1755>.
Thou shalt arise<WH6965>, and have mercy<WH7355> upon Zion<WH6726>: for the time<WH6256> to favour<WH2603> her, yea, the set time<WH4150>, is come<WH935>.
For thy servants<WH5650> take pleasure<WH7521> in her stones<WH68>, and favour<WH2603> the dust<WH6083> thereof.
So the heathen<WH1471> shall fear<WH3372> the name<WH8034> of the LORD<WH3068>, and all the kings<WH4428> of the earth<WH776> thy glory<WH3519>.
When the LORD<WH3068> shall build up<WH1129> Zion<WH6726>, he shall appear<WH7200> in his glory<WH3519>.
He will regard<WH6437> the prayer<WH8605> of the destitute<WH6199>, and not despise<WH959> their prayer<WH8605>.
This shall be written<WH3789> for the generation<WH1755> to come<WH314>: and the people<WH5971> which shall be created<WH1254> shall praise<WH1984> the LORD<WH3050>.
For he hath looked down<WH8259> from the height<WH4791> of his sanctuary<WH6944>; from heaven<WH8064> did the LORD<WH3068> behold<WH5027> the earth<WH776>;
To hear<WH8085> the groaning<WH603> of the prisoner<WH615>; to loose<WH6605> those that are appointed<WH1121> to death<WH8546>;
To declare<WH5608> the name<WH8034> of the LORD<WH3068> in Zion<WH6726>, and his praise<WH8416> in Jerusalem<WH3389>;
When the people<WH5971> are gathered<WH6908> together<WH3162>, and the kingdoms<WH4467>, to serve<WH5647> the LORD<WH3068>.
He weakened<WH6031> my strength<WH3581> in the way<WH1870>; he shortened<WH7114> my days<WH3117>.
I said<WH559>, O my God<WH410>, take me not away<WH5927> in the midst<WH2677> of my days<WH3117>: thy years<WH8141> are throughout all<WH1755> generations<WH1755>.
Of old<WH6440> hast thou laid the foundation<WH3245> of the earth<WH776>: and the heavens<WH8064> are the work<WH4639> of thy hands<WH3027>.

They shall perish<WH6>, but thou shalt endure<WH5975>: yea, all of them shall wax old<WH1086> like a garment<WH899>; as a vesture<WH3830> shalt thou change<WH2498> them, and they shall be changed<WH2498>:
But thou art the same, and thy years<WH8141> shall have no end<WH8552>.
The children<WH1121> of thy servants<WH5650> shall continue<WH7931>, and their seed<WH2233> shall be established<WH3559> before<WH6440> thee.
